questions.question: Which function key is the standard shortcut to start a Slide Show from the very first slide?
questions.explanation: Pressing F5 launches the presentation from the beginning (Slide 1).

questions.question: If you are on Slide 10 and want to start the presentation immediately from that specific slide, which shortcut should you use?
questions.explanation: Shift + F5 starts the Slide Show from the currently active slide.

questions.question: What is the purpose of 'Rehearse with Coach' (Presenter Coach)?
options: To use AI to analyze your speech and give feedback on pacing, pitch, and filler words
questions.explanation: Presenter Coach uses AI to listen to your rehearsal and provides a report on your speaking skills.

questions.question: Which feature allows you to see your speaker notes and the next slide on your laptop while the audience only sees the current slide on the projector?
questions.explanation: Presenter View optimizes the experience for dual monitors, giving the presenter private tools.

questions.question: In the 'Set Up Show' dialog box, which option would you check to make the presentation repeat automatically until you press Esc?
questions.explanation: The 'Loop continuously' option is commonly used for kiosks or unattended displays.

questions.question: What is a 'Custom Slide Show'?
options: A subset of slides from the original presentation tailored for a specific audience
questions.explanation: Custom Shows allow you to group specific slides together to present them without modifying the original file.

questions.question: If you want to skip a specific slide during the presentation without deleting it, what should you do?
questions.explanation: Hiding a slide keeps it in the file for editing but skips it during the actual Slide Show.

questions.question: Which tool in the Slide Show tab helps you practice by tracking exactly how much time you spend on each slide?
questions.explanation: Rehearse Timings runs the show and records the time spent on each slide, which can be saved for automatic playback.

questions.question: What happens if you check 'Show without narration' in the Set Up Slide Show options?
options: Any recorded voice-over or audio narration will be muted during the show
questions.explanation: This setting suppresses recorded narrations for live presentations where the speaker wants to talk live.

questions.question: To write on the slide during a presentation (like a digital whiteboard), which feature can you use?
questions.explanation: Presenter tools include a Pen and Laser Pointer to annotate slides live.

questions.question: When 'Browsed at a kiosk (full screen)' is selected in Set Up Show, how do users advance slides?
options: Usually via automatic timing or hyperlinks/action buttons (mouse click advancement is often disabled)
questions.explanation: Kiosk mode restricts control, preventing users from changing slides manually unless action buttons are provided.

questions.question: Which key typically ends a running Slide Show?
questions.explanation: The Esc key exits the Slide Show view and returns to the editor.

questions.question: The 'Record Slide Show' feature allows you to:
options: Record voice narration, slide timings, and laser pointer gestures for the entire presentation
Record a song from the internet
questions.explanation: Record Slide Show captures audio and timing elements to create a self-running video or show.

questions.question: If you have multiple monitors connected, which setting ensures the presentation appears on the projector?
options: Monitor setting in the Slide Show tab
questions.explanation: The 'Monitors' group allows you to choose which screen displays the slide show and which shows Presenter View.

questions.question: During a presentation, pressing 'B' on the keyboard will:
questions.explanation: Pressing 'B' (Black) or 'W' (White) pauses the show by blanking the screen to focus attention on the speaker.

questions.question: [AI Tool] Presenter Coach might warn you if you use too many 'fillers'. What are fillers?
questions.explanation: Fillers are hesitation words that can make a speaker sound less confident.

questions.question: Which option allows you to broadcast your presentation over the internet to remote viewers?
questions.explanation: Present Online (Office Presentation Service) creates a link for others to watch the slideshow in their browser.

questions.question: In the 'Start Slide Show' group, 'From Beginning' always starts at:
questions.explanation: It launches the show from the title slide (Slide 1).

questions.question: What is the benefit of 'Use Timings' being checked?
options: The slides will advance automatically based on the rehearsed timings
questions.explanation: If unchecked, the show ignores recorded timings and waits for mouse clicks.

questions.question: Can Presenter Coach detect if you are just reading the text off the slide?
options: Yes, it warns you against reading verbatim to keep the audience engaged
No, AI is not that smart
questions.explanation: Advanced AI in Presenter Coach compares your speech to the slide text and flags if you are reading word-for-word.
